content: This contribution hasn’t received enough positive votes from the community. The "FASTEST" option has therefore been deactivated.

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: nice and simple

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: it is good work

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Nice solver clash, not too complicated.

Goal section:
Suggest the following changes in the Goal section:
Add a full stop to every sentence.
unknow char is "_" -> "_" denotes an unknown character
solution -> possible word
All word -> All words
in dictionary -> in the dictionary
lower case char -> lower case characters
char -> characters (several times)
will be push -> will be revealed
h__gm__ will be -> h__gm__ will become
have been push -> are revealed

Input section and Output section: Please follow the presentation with reference to the example in the contribution guidelines:
https://www.codingame.com/playgrounds/40701/help-center/statement#guidelines
In particular:
<<Line 2:>> An integer [[N]] for the number of elements in the dictionary
<<Next [[N]] lines:>> One [[word]] in the dictionary 
<<[[M]] lines:>> One [[validWord]] in the dictionary

Constraints section:
1 <= M <= N should be moved to Constraints section.
All variables M and N should be formatted.

Tests and validators should be different. Currently Test 2 and Validator 2 are the same, and Test 3 and Validator 3 are the same.

You may want to have longer/more words to utilise the constraints more fully, though it is not necessary.

Maybe reverse mode also works?
Nice, you should just explicit the order of the output.

Thanks for your constructive comment, I have take into account all your points (I think)
I think it's too hard for a reverse mode clash, because of the hangman rule "reveal characters x at the same time"

Thank you. Now the revised list of comments:

Goal section:
Add a full stop to every sentence.
solution -> possible word
char -> characters (several times)
will will -> will
be reveal -> be revealed
have revealed -> are revealed

Input section:
elements -> words

Constraints section:
"number of characters" can be deleted.
"number of words in the dictionary" can be deleted.
Add "where [[M]] is the " before "number of results to output".
